attributes.additional_details: The government need to regulate dogs and their owners so that dogs are always under control when in a public space. Any new policy must have sufficient consequences for non-compliance along with adequate monitoring facilities.
attributes.background: There seems to be a rise in the number of dog attacks around the country lately. Is this an accurate observation or are they in the media more? Either way, I know I don't want my own children, or anyone I know to be on the other end of one if these attacks again.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We understand that you're concerned about attacks by dogs, but we're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do.

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.

We have published the following petition, which you might like to sign:

Require dogs in public places to be on a lead at all times: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/634272

Make all dogs no matter what breed muzzled in public: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/633198

Require leads, muzzles and licences for all dogs: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/638225

Lifetime ban on dog ownership for anyone whose dog attacks a person: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/639062
